name: Node.js Essentials
description: Core Node.js concepts and backend development

questions.question: What is Node.js?
questions.answer: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine for running JavaScript outside the browser

questions.question: What is npm?
questions.answer: Node Package Manager - the default package manager for Node.js to install and manage dependencies

questions.question: What is the event loop in Node.js?
questions.answer: A mechanism that handles asynchronous operations by executing callbacks when operations complete

questions.question: What is the difference between require() and import?
questions.answer: require() is CommonJS (synchronous), import is ES6 modules (can be asynchronous and tree-shakeable)

questions.question: What is middleware in Express?
questions.answer: Functions that have access to request, response objects and can modify them or end the request-response cycle

questions.question: What is callback hell?
questions.answer: Nested callbacks that make code hard to read and maintain, solved by Promises or async/await

questions.question: What are streams in Node.js?
questions.answer: Objects that let you read or write data piece by piece instead of all at once, useful for large files

questions.question: What is the purpose of process.env?
questions.answer: Object containing environment variables for configuration (API keys, database URLs, etc.)
